snippet.title: Y.: nfsp: A distributed nfs server for clusters of workstations
snippet.description:
Y.: nfsp: A distributed nfs server for clusters of workstations
by Pierre Lombard, Yves Denneulin \- In: Proc. of International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium. (2002
"... Kuntzmann, 38330 Montbonnot Saint-Martin, France Pierre.Lombard,Yves.Denneulin @(email omitted); Abstract A ..."
Abstract \- Cited by 9 (2 self) \- Add to MetaCart
A consequence of the increasing popularity of Beowulf clusters has been their increasing size (in number of nodes). Yet, the hard drives available on these nodes are only used for the system and temporary files, thus wasting a lot of space (several TiB on large clusters!). The systems that might help recycling this otherwise-unused space are few and far between. This paper presents a NFS server that aims at using the unused disk space spread over the cluster nodes and at offering performance and scalability improvements (compared to the plain NFS servers). The architecture of our solution uses a metaserver and I/O daemons. The client only sees plain NFS, thanks to NFS over UDP spoofing techniques. A first implementation and early performances are shown for this approach. 1

snippet.title: The Microlocal Landau-Zener Formula
snippet.description:
The Microlocal Landau-Zener Formula
by Yves Colin de Verdière, Maurice Lombardi, Joël Pollet , 2011
"... -UJF 5582 BP 74, 38402-Saint Martin d’Hères Cedex (France) yves ..."
Abstract \- Cited by 4 (1 self) \- Add to MetaCart
We describe the space of microlocal solutions of a 2 × 2 system of pseudo-differential operators (PDO) on the real line near an avoided crossing (2-levels system). We prove Landau-Zener type formulae in the adiabatic case with avoided crossings and for the classical limit of coupled Schrödinger operators (Born-Oppenheimer approximation). The formulae that we get are uniform in the set of small parameters (Planck constant and coupling constant), they admits an uniquely determined complete asymptotic expansion and allow to access simply to phases which are needed in order to derive quantization conditions. The present paper is an expanded version of results already obtained by Joël Pollet in his PhD thesis [22]. Quantization conditions will be described in [5], following the techniques of [8]. See also [25] concerning the scattering matrix. An extension to time dependent Schrödinger equation close to the work by Hagedorn [13] and Hagedorn-Joye [14] and based on [20], [10] and [27] is also in preparation.

snippet.title: ACQUISITION OF A FOREIGN LANGUAGE IN GLOBAL WORLD WITH SPECIAL REFERENCE TO FRENCH
snippet.description:
ACQUISITION OF A FOREIGN LANGUAGE IN GLOBAL WORLD WITH SPECIAL REFERENCE TO FRENCH
by Rashmi Garg
"... like Yves Saint Laurent, Claude Montana, Pierre Cardin, Sonia Rykiel, Jean-Paul Gaultier, Paco Rabanne ..."
Abstract \- Add to MetaCart
Globalisation, modern developments-both in business and technology, have reduced the world from a vast entity to a palm-sized one. English is fast becoming a universal language but French still occupies the position of being the second most popular and used language all over the world. France had colonies worldwide due to which French speaking or Francophones can be found in nearly every niche of the earth-having any human civilization. Inspite of France, being highly renowned as the land of Fashion and Wine, there are lot more aspects about the country as well as the language, which are still unknown for a common man. In earlier days when traditional society existed, the knowledge was limited. The main objective of the education and educators was to preserve the education. Whereas, in modern society, the knowledge is vast and the pace of growth of education and knowledge is endless. The main aim of the students as well as the educators is to keep pace with the advancement in knowledge in rest of the world. Why learn a foreign language? Due to progress in technology and globalization of the world, knowledge and education have stopped being perceived passively. The speed with which the social changes take place, the conservation of education will definitely be harmful. Now, the education has to be always evolving. Nowadays, the need for knowledge of another foreign language, apart from English is being emphasized for certain streams. It is termed as second or third language acquisition. In future, it is assumed that only India, itself will require an increased number of individuals, who should be highly proficient in major foreign languages and their culture as well as their literature. Hence, it is necessary to have a few schools or institutes specializing in teaching these languages right form an early age. Learning a foreign language requires both time and effort to gain a working fluency. Since, the world has become a small place, the requirement for information sharing has increased. Learning a second language in these challenging times can significantly enhance the career and job prospects. Many excuses can be quoted for learning a foreign language.

snippet.title: Rapid communications A major outbreak of gastroenteritis in Réunion Island in 2012: first identification of G12 rotavirus on the Island
snippet.description:
Rapid communications A major outbreak of gastroenteritis in Réunion Island in 2012: first identification of G12 rotavirus on the Island
by P Vilain, E Brottet, J Kaplon, K Ambert-balay, D Polycarpe, L Filleul , 2013
"... , Emergency Department, University Hospital Centre of Saint-Denis, Réunion, France, Dr Yves Jacques Antoine ..."
Abstract \- Add to MetaCart
of gastroenteritis occurred on Réunion Island, affecting more than 50,000 cases, particularly young children. Virological analyses showed that the virus responsible for this epidemic was rotavirus. Genotyping of stool samples indicated circulation of rotavirus type G3P[8] but also G12P[8], highlighting the risk of global emergence of this genotype in the coming years. On Réunion Island, a French overseas administrated territory located in the south-western Indian Ocean, gastroenteritis outbreaks are usually observed during the austral winter, between the months of August and November. While outbreaks of gastroenteritis had been of moderate severity on the island between 2008 and 2011 [1], an intense epidemic occurred in 2012. Monitoring has been in place for several years, involving
